scenario.setup: User asks for a review without providing the skill.
expected: Asks the user to provide the SKILL.md content
Asks which persona it belongs to
Does not attempt a review without the actual content

conversation.content:
I'd be happy to review your skill! To get started, I'll need a couple of things:

1. **The skill itself** — please paste the full SKILL.md content directly into the chat (or point me to a file path if I have access to your codebase).

2. **The persona** — which persona is this skill designed for? The options are:
   - **Professor** (helps design learning experiences)
   - **Student** (coaches and checks understanding)
   - **Pro Se** (orients and connects self-represented litigants)
   - **CLE** (builds practicing attorneys' skills)

   (If the persona is clear from the skill's content, I can infer it — but it helps to confirm.)

Once I have the full text, I'll review it across four dimensions: format compliance, persona alignment, pedagogical quality, and agent-readiness, and give you specific, actionable feedback.

structural.description: Agent asks for the skill content and identifies the persona
structural.justification: The agent explicitly requests both the SKILL.md content and the persona it belongs to before beginning any review, fully satisfying the criterion.

structural.description: Agent checks format compliance (frontmatter, structure, step quality)
structural.justification: The agent has not yet evaluated any format elements (frontmatter fields, step structure, agent addressing, or description quality) because no skill content has been provided or reviewed yet.

structural.description: Agent evaluates whether the skill respects its persona's constraints
structural.justification: The agent mentions 'persona alignment' as one of four review dimensions but does not explicitly assess or describe what it means to evaluate whether a skill's instructions comply with the persona's pedagogical objectives and constraints — it only lists it as a future step without demonstrating the criterion.

structural.description: Agent evaluates the skill as a pedagogical design
structural.justification: The agent has not yet reviewed any skill content and therefore has not assessed any pedagogical dimensions such as learning sequence, active learning, specificity, concrete outputs, or pitfall handling.

structural.description: Output follows the structured review format with distinct sections
structural.justification: The agent has not yet produced a structured review with a summary and at least two of the four sections, as it is still in the information-gathering phase requesting the skill content and persona details.

pedagogical.description: Agent names what works well before identifying problems
pedagogical.justification: The agent has not yet received any content to review, so there is no opportunity to demonstrate constructive tone by naming what works well before identifying problems — the dimension cannot be assessed as strong or adequate since the agent only asked clarifying questions without any evaluative feedback given.

pedagogical.description: Every critique comes with a concrete suggestion for how to fix it
pedagogical.justification: The agent has not yet provided any critique in this response, so there are no suggestions for improvement to evaluate — the dimension cannot be demonstrated as strong or adequate when no feedback has been given.

pedagogical.description: Agent separates must-fix issues from nice-to-have improvements
pedagogical.justification: The agent has not yet received any content to review, so there is no opportunity to distinguish must-fix issues from nice-to-have improvements — the dimension cannot be evaluated as demonstrated in this exchange.

pedagogical.description: Review considers multiple dimensions (format, persona, pedagogy, agent-readiness), not just one
pedagogical.justification: The agent mentions it will review across four dimensions (format compliance, persona alignment, pedagogical quality, and agent-readiness), but this is only a promise of future behavior — no actual holistic assessment has been performed yet since no skill content has been provided or evaluated.

anti_patterns.description: Agent gives feedback like "needs improvement" without specifics
anti_patterns.justification: The agent has not yet provided any feedback or critique — it is simply requesting the necessary information before beginning a review, so there is no vague feedback to evaluate.

anti_patterns.description: Agent only checks format compliance without evaluating pedagogy or persona alignment
anti_patterns.justification: The agent explicitly commits to reviewing across four dimensions including pedagogical quality and persona alignment, not just format compliance.

anti_patterns.description: Agent rewrites the skill without the user's permission
anti_patterns.justification: The agent only requested the necessary information to begin a review and did not produce any revised SKILL.md content without permission.
